Red dragons are the second strongest chromatic dragons. They primarily attack using a Fire Bolt spell, but as with all dragons, they can use a magic-based dragonfire attack. They also use melee if the player gets within melee range. The dragonbreath attack can hit from a distance as well as up close, so an anti-dragon shield, the Protect from Magic prayer, or an antifire potion are essential when fighting them as they can otherwise hit over 1500. Money can be made by selling their drops. Collecting the hides and bones makes each kill worth approximately 3,099 coins.

If assigned red dragons as a slayer task, baby red dragons may be killed as an alternative.

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Requirements Spawns Map
Red Dragon Isle (level 41 Wilderness)84None4Maplink
Brimhaven Dungeon84None6Maplink

Strategy[edit | edit source]

As with all dragons, protection from their dragonfire is required. The following can be combined to provide full dragonfire protection:

  • An anti-dragon shield or dragonfire shield (melee), deflector (ranged), or ward (magic) (DFS) with an antifire potion
  • An anti-dragon shield or DFS with the protect from magic prayer or deflect magic curse
  • Protect from/deflect magic and antifire potion

Alternatively, a super antifire potion provides complete immunity to dragonfire.

The dragons are weakest to bolts, so Ranged is the most effective style. Melee is not recommended without high combat stats and equipment.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 4,784 samples from the Drop Log Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Red dragon kill is worth 4,321 coins.

Rare drop table drops[edit | edit source]

This monster has access to the rare drop table.
Luck-enhancing items are not required to access the table, but they will increase the chance of accessing the rare drop table and may also improve the loot received from it.

Universal drops[edit | edit source]

Universal drops are dropped by nearly every monster and skilling action outside of Daemonheim.
These items are dropped alongside main drops.

    • Update history[edit | edit source]

    This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
    • ninja 9 October 2017 (Update):
      • Red dragons now drop between one to eight rune darts. Eight is no longer guaranteed.
    • ninja 25 April 2016 (Update):
      • Improved respawn rates for Red Dragons.
    • update 5 July 2010 (Update):
      • Graphical overhaul to chromatics, including baby variants.
    • patch 9 September 2009 (Update):
      • Improved various dragons’ fire-breath code behaviour to match the KBD's existing behaviour. The actual animation has not changed.
    • update 27 February 2002 (Update):
      • Added to game.
